lessons.title: Introduction to DSA
lessons.videoScript:
Lesson 1: Introduction to DSA

Hi, I’m Champak Roy, and welcome to Programmer's Picnic.
In this lesson, we will explore the topic: Introduction to DSA. We’ll understand the core ideas, see Python code examples, and end with practice problems and homework so you can apply what you learn.
codeExamples:
# Example for Lesson 1: Introduction to DSA
def demo():
    print('This is a placeholder demo for Introduction to DSA.')

demo()
lessons.blogArticle:
This is the blog article for Lesson 1: Introduction to DSA. Here you will explain the concept in detail, include diagrams if needed, and show Python code examples.

You can expand this text later with real content, but this structure is ready to plug into your app.
practiceProblems: Easy: A beginner-level problem related to Introduction to DSA.
Medium: A moderate difficulty problem to practice Introduction to DSA.
Challenge: A harder / interview-style problem using concepts from Introduction to DSA.
homework: HW1: Implement the practice problems for Introduction to DSA and push to your GitHub repo 'programmers-picnic/lesson-1'.
HW2 (Optional): Write a short blog post in your own words explaining Introduction to DSA with examples.
